title: Lörrach
summary: Lörrach (German pronunciation: [ˈlœrax][3]) is a town in southwest Germany, in the valley of the Wiese, close to the French and the Swiss borders. It is the capital of the district of Lörrach in Baden-Württemberg. It is the home of a number of large employers, including the Milka chocolate factory owned by Mondelez International. The city population has grown over the last century, with only 10,794 in 1905  it has now increased its population to 49,382.[4]
